  • Constructor Details

    • Section

      public Section​(CompoundTag sectionRoot, int dataVersion)

    • Section

      public Section​(CompoundTag sectionRoot, int dataVersion, long loadFlags)

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the data of this Section is empty.
      Returns:
      true if empty

    • getBlockStateAt

      public CompoundTag getBlockStateAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ)
      Fetches a block state based on a block location from this section. The coordinates represent the location of the block inside of this Section.
      Parameters:
      blockX - The x-coordinate of the block in this Section
      blockY - The y-coordinate of the block in this Section
      blockZ - The z-coordinate of the block in this Section
      Returns:
      The block state data of this block.

    • setBlockStateAt

      public void setBlockStateAt​(int blockX, int blockY, int blockZ, CompoundTag state, boolean cleanup)
      Attempts to add a block state for a specific block location in this Section.
      Parameters:
      blockX - The x-coordinate of the block in this Section
      blockY - The y-coordinate of the block in this Section
      blockZ - The z-coordinate of the block in this Section
      state - The block state to be set
      cleanup - When true, it will cleanup the palette of this section. This option should only be used moderately to avoid unnecessary recalculation of the palette indices. Recalculating the Palette should only be executed once right before saving the Section to file.

    • getPaletteIndex

      public int getPaletteIndex​(int blockStateIndex)
      Returns the index of the block data in the palette.
      Parameters:
      blockStateIndex - The index of the block in this section, ranging from 0-4095.
      Returns:
      The index of the block data in the palette.

    • setPaletteIndex

      public void setPaletteIndex​(int blockIndex, int paletteIndex, long[] blockStates)
      Sets the index of the block data in the BlockStates. Does not adjust the size of the BlockStates array.
      Parameters:
      blockIndex - The index of the block in this section, ranging from 0-4095.
      paletteIndex - The block state to be set (index of block data in the palette).
      blockStates - The block states to be updated.

    • getPalette

      public ListTag<CompoundTag> getPalette()
      Fetches the palette of this Section.
      Returns:
      The palette of this Section.

    • cleanupPaletteAndBlockStates

      public void cleanupPaletteAndBlockStates()
      This method recalculates the palette and its indices. This should only be used moderately to avoid unnecessary recalculation of the palette indices. Recalculating the Palette should only be executed once right before saving the Section to file.

    • getBlockLight

      public byte[] getBlockLight()
      Returns:
      The block light array of this Section

    • setBlockLight

      public void setBlockLight​(byte[] blockLight)
      Sets the block light array for this section.
      Parameters:
      blockLight - The block light array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the length of the array is not 2048

    • getBlockStates

      public long[] getBlockStates()
      Returns:
      The indices of the block states of this Section.

    • setBlockStates

      public void setBlockStates​(long[] blockStates)
      Sets the block state indices to a custom value.
      Parameters:
      blockStates - The block state indices.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If blockStates is null
      IllegalArgumentException - When blockStates' length is < 256 or > 4096 and is not a multiple of 64

    • getSkyLight

      public byte[] getSkyLight()
      Returns:
      The sky light values of this Section

    • setSkyLight

      public void setSkyLight​(byte[] skyLight)
      Sets the sky light values of this section.
      Parameters:
      skyLight - The custom sky light values
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the length of the array is not 2048

    • newSection

      public static Section newSection()
      Creates an empty Section with base values.
      Returns:
      An empty Section

    • updateHandle

      public CompoundTag updateHandle​(int y)
      Updates the raw CompoundTag that this Section is based on. This must be called before saving a Section to disk if the Section was manually created to set the Y of this Section.
      Parameters:
      y - The Y-value of this Section
      Returns:
      A reference to the raw CompoundTag this Section is based on
